ygData.subject: Re: Jewelry and skill raises
ygData.msgSnippet: Unfortunately, skill increase is very unpredictable. I ve had it go up twice in a row, I ve had it go up on failure, and I ve had it take 10 successful jewelry
ygData.messageBody:
Unfortunately, skill increase is very unpredictable. I've had it go up twice
in a row, I've had it go up on failure, and I've had it take 10 successful
jewelry attempts. I have *no* idea how to know when it will go up. Just keep
using the cheap gems until you get the "too trivial" message and then move
to the next gem up in the list.

Djar Lightbringer, Chancellor of HOA (Tarew Marr Server)
Servant of Light, Deliverer of the Truth to Norrath
http://www.hoa-rpg.com/

> -----Original Message-----
> From: jcent@... [mailto:jcent@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 9:18 AM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqenchanters] Jewelry and skill raises
>
>
> From: jcent@...
>
>
> Hail and well met, fellow enchanters!
>
> I am Fistlebane, high elf enchanter {of The Rathe server}. I started my
> jewelry making craft fairly recently (after sinking about
> practice points).
> I found that when I try to use lapis or malachite that I receive
> a message:
> these items are trivial for your skill level. I stepped up to Cat's Eye
> and made about 5 necklaces with Cat's eye...but got no visible message
> telling me that my skill had raised. I am impatient? How many attempts
> are required, generally, before you see an increase?
>
> Thanks for the feedback.
>
> Fistlebane
>
>
